text: Clinical symptoms of gastric and duodenal ulcers « Dyspepsia: postprandial heaviness, early satiety, and gnawing, aching, or burning epigastric pain * Pain relief with antacids Findings common to both * Potential signs of internal bleeding (e.g., anemia, hematemesis, melena) * Stool sample positive for occult blood (see “Diagnostics” in “Gastrointestinal bleeding”) ) ) « Pain is relieved with food intake — weight gain {=] Pain and eating * Pain increases shortly after eating — weight loss {=] * Pain increases 2-5 hours after eating. 7} S + More commen 2
